data.title: subgenre
data.meta_description: SUBGENRE meaning: 1. a genre (= a style, especially in the arts, that involves a particular set of characteristics…. Learn more.
data.text:
noun [ C ]

(also sub-genre) us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈsʌbˌʒɑːn.rə/ uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈsʌbˌʒɒn.rə/

a genre (= a style, especially in the arts, that involves a particular set of characteristics) that is part of a larger genre:

More examplesFewer examples

She wrote novels that belonged to a distinct subgenre of dystopian science fiction.

He became famous after appearing in movies belonging to a subgenre of contemporary Korean cinema.

They don't confine themselves to just one sub-genre of video game and will experiment widely.

(Definition of subgenre from the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary & Thesaurus © Cambridge University Press)

Examples of subgenre

subgenre

Much recent writing concerning the early eighteenth-century sonata has focused on a subgenre that appropriates stylistic elements from more fully scored works.

But there are more important reasons to interpret this opera as belonging to the subgenre of sentimental opera rather than slapstick musical comedy.

The most prevalent subgenre in the early repertoire is the serenata.

Live recordings are a specialty item, or subgenre.

Nevertheless, bounce has influenced a variety of other rap subgenres and even emerged in the mainstream.
